definition: exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb

sentences.english: II. 199 foreign business invested commercial enterprises need to make rectifications after sorting out.
sentences.chinese: 经过清理需要进行整改的外商投资商业企业199家。

sentences.english: France's Gendarmerie Nationale recently decided to review its IT infrastructure policies.
sentences.chinese: 法国国家宪兵队最近决定整改它的IT基建设施政策。

sentences.english: China is set to reshape its government-funded public institutions to improve public services.
sentences.chinese: 为提高公共服务质量，我国将对事业单位进行整改。

sentences.english: Some concrete and effective measures for rectifying above status was put forward.
sentences.chinese: 提出了具体有效的整改措施。

sentences.english: The administration says these changes will have no cost to taxpayers.
sentences.chinese: 联邦政府表示这些整改计划不会对纳税人增加负担。

sentences.english: Safety Committee will register the potential risks and improvement.
sentences.chinese: 安委会将有关隐患及整改结果登记存档。

sentences.english: To supervise the self-examination and periodically service industry.
sentences.chinese: 还要督促服务行业定期开展自查和整改。

sentences.english: Complete self-inspection report, and follow up the actions related to self-inspection findings.
sentences.chinese: 完成自检报告，并跟进整改行动。

sentences.english: The causes for deterioration of heat conducting oil were analyzed, and the countermeasures and its effects were introduced.
sentences.chinese: 分析了焦化厂导热油变质原因，介绍整改措施与效果。

sentences.english: Supplier Xinge has sent its corrective measures and proofs back.
sentences.chinese: 供应商新格已将整改措施及证据回传给过来。

sentences.english: In order to address these problems, Shengwen immediately adopted three rectifications and reforms.
sentences.chinese: 针对这些情况，盛文迅速进行了三项整改。

sentences.english: Finally some suggestions and reform measures to prevent this kind of accidents are proposed.
sentences.chinese: 最后提出了避免该类事故发生的相关建议和整改措施。

sentences.english: After receipt of the letter of non-compliance the operator will be given the opportunity to implement corrective measures.
sentences.chinese: 收到不符合通知后，操作者有机会实施整改措施。

sentences.english: The schedule of refits , refreshes, extensions and new store openings.
sentences.chinese: 整改，装修，扩张和新开店计划。

sentences.english: China wants to show that it is serious about improving the image of its food and drug products.
sentences.chinese: 中国想要表现出对整改药监局非常重视的样子。

sentences.english: To review and verify the reports on the rectification of related financial institutions.
sentences.chinese: 负责审核有关金融机构整改报告的具体工作。

definition: to bring under control/to regulate/to restore to good condition/(coll.) to fix (a person)/to prepare (a meal etc)
(of a power plant, refinery etc) to shut down
to suppress/to crack down on/to prohibit
to order/to enjoin/to charge/to instruct sb to finish sth
to tear down/to demolish/to dismantle/to remove
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
abbr. for 違章建築|违章建筑, illegal construction
to set a time limit/time limit/deadline
to charge (an entity) with (a task)/to assign (sb) the task of
to hold accountable/to blame/to censure/to apportion blame
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to inspect/to run through a checklist/to take stock/to audit
to be overdue/to fail to meet a deadline/to be behind in doing sth
to take down from the shelves (e.g. a contaminated product)
